Catalysts were synthesized according to the literature.
46 Precursor tetra- n-butylammonium permanganate ( n-Bu 4NMnO 4) was synthesized by slowly adding an aqueous n-Bu 4NBr solution to an aqueous KMnO 4 solution under vigorous stirring. This was followed by stirring for 1 h. CMO_T and L: n-Bu 4NMnO 4 (2 mmol) powder was slowly added to a CoCl 2 (2 mmol) solution in a mixture of 2-propanol (50 mL) and water to obtain a molar ratio of H 2O/CoCl 2 = 600 and 60, respectively. The solution was refluxed for 3 h. CMO_S: n-Bu 4NMnO 4 (2 mmol) powder was slowly added to an anhydrous CoCl 2 (2 mmol) solution in 2-propanol (50 mL) to form a colloidal solution. The solution was stirred for 30 min at room temperature followed by the addition of deionized water to form precipitates. Previous work reveals that the amount of H 2O affects the structure of the binary oxide,
46 while the excess amount of CoCl 2 does not affect the characteristics. These precipitates were collected by membrane filtration, washed with water and ethanol, and dried at 120 °C. Caution: n-Bu 4NMnO 4 can react violently with itself (the MnO 4 – anion can oxidize the n-Bu 4N cation) and possibly catch fire; hence, it should be handled with appropriate care and stored under appropriate conditions (e.g ., refrigerated conditions).
